alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 7:36PM CDT until May 11 at 4:36PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Kansas... Spring River above Baxter Springs affecting Cherokee County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Gasconade River at Jerome affecting Phelps County. Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. For the Gasconade River Basin...including Jerome, Hazelgreen...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Fulton, Horton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River Basin...including Fort Scott, Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs at the gage site. Low lying areas along Route D near Stotesbury flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 45.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM CDT Sunday was 45.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon and continue falling to 28.6 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 44.9 feet on 05/11/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
